text:
Preparing the fringe pieces Cut 4 to 6 long lengths of newspaper. The lengths should vary, some being at least 15cm (6 inches) wide, some narrower. Fold one strip in half, lengthwise. Mark even cutting points all the way along the folded edge of the strip. Then cut along the length to create a fringe. Do not cut all the way through, just to about an inch (2.5cm) before the edge. Repeat with the remaining lengths. Turn all of them into a basic fringe length. Creating the looped "flowers" Take one of the fringes and roll it up. Secure by winding tape around the base of the fringe to form a type of stem. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/57\/Make-a-Newspaper-Gift-Bow-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Newspaper-Gift-Bow-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/57\/Make-a-Newspaper-Gift-Bow-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid2679638-v4-728px-Make-a-Newspaper-Gift-Bow-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

Making the bow Hold all of the newspaper flowers together at the stems. Arrange so that the larger flowers are in the center and the smaller ones are on the outside. Wrap the stems together with tape. Wrap at the mid-point, to leave the ends unwrapped to allow for attaching to the gift wrapping. Fluff out gently to look like a large, well looped bow. Wrapping the gift Wrap the gift in a layer of nice newspaper. Choose a piece that is not creased and looks pleasant. Avoid using a piece with horrible stories on it; gifts are about good news! Add the newspaper bow. Use the loose ends to attach the bow to the wrapping paper with tape. Fluff out once more and the gift is ready to give.
